meanings.definition: The 15th day of March, May, July, or October in the ancient Roman calendar.
meanings.sent1: On the ides of March, people in ancient Rome celebrated a special festival.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, the ides marked an important date in the Roman calendar.
meanings.sent3: The ides of July were known for their colorful festivities.
meanings.sent4: The ides of October brought about the end of the harvest season.
meanings.sent5: Children in history books learn about the ides as a significant day in Rome.

meanings.definition: A day falling roughly in the middle of a month, originally the 15th day of March, May, July, or October.
meanings.sent1: The ides of a month usually fall around the middle of the calendar.
meanings.sent2: People often refer to the ides as a midpoint in a month.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would celebrate the ides of May with a cake.
meanings.sent4: The ides of March can feel like a turning point in the month.
meanings.sent5: Remembering the ides helps us understand ancient timekeeping better.
